bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from James L. Hanberry to Philip Showalter Hench, May 18, 1948

div1.p: Hanberry sends Hench some news clippings concerning his participation in the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from James L. Hanberry to Philip Showalter Hench, May 18, 1948
div1.opener:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF SOUTH CAROLINA
United Spanish War Veterans
STAR ROUTE 77 ORANGEBURG, SOUTH CAROLINA
JOHN MAYER, SR. VICE-COMMANDER
POMARIA, S. C.
WALTER HUTTO
DEPARTMENT COMMANDER
W. H. WORRELL, JR. VICE-COMMANDER
EFFINGHAM, S. C.
J. L. HANBERRY, ADJUTANT AND QUARTERMASTER, 61 SUMMERS AVE. ORANGEBURG, S. C.
Orangeburg S. C.
May 18 48
Dr Phillip Hench
Dear Sir
div1.p:
I am sending you news
Paper clippings of my try. You will find several
Misstatements in them you know all the facts
about Maj. Reeds experiments so please dont
critisize me for any mistakes you may find
I want to thank you again for the
wonderful kindness shone me I will
always rember them. shall look forward
to receiving copy of my Bed side chart
again thanking you
div1.closer: I am Sincerily J L Hanberry Orangeburg S. C.
